maintenance-item.para: The Side Destination Sign (SDS) displays text strings (the destination station) sent by the Communication Control Unit.

Two SDS units (SDS1 and SDS2) are located on the upper level of all cars. (See Figure and Table The SDS units are bolted through the window mask to supports attached to the carbody. Each unit weighs approximately 13 lb and its extruded aluminium body, painted black, measures approximately 6.25 in. high, 37.0 in. wide, and 4.0 in. deep.
The display face of the unit is oriented outside the train, pressed against the side window glass. A hollow synthetic rubber gasket between the display face and window seals against dust and liquids.

The cabin side of the SDS unit is protected by a fiberglass shroud. The shroud is hinged at the bottom edge, to ease access for maintenance, and secured with two captive, tamper-resistant quarter-turn latches.
The SDS has a touch pad assembly with one pushbutton and three indicators. (See Table .)

A two-plug car wiring cable connects to the 12-pin SDS connector, providing both car battery power and connections to the Data Car Network (DCN). A ground wire connects the SDS ground stud to the carbody. (See Table .)

entry.para: 74 Vdc car battery power, supplied through 2-pole, 10 A circuit breaker SIGNS (CB46)

row.entry: Sign location and identification jumper pins
